posts.content:
The Dark Sorceress


Image source: https://cdn3.artstation.com/p/assets/im ... -blitz.jpg

Greetings again!

Wizard / Palemasters have a number of advantages over Sorcerer / Palemasters.
One feature that sorcerers have the advantage over wizards is the Cha statistic can be harnessed into boosting saves.
Usually paladin's divine grace is involved for outstanding saves with a single level investment. 
Due to alignment restrictions, both paladin and palemaster together usually cannot be taken without alignment change, although a Sorcerer 29 / Paladin 1 / PM 10 build would be extremely powerful, in my opinion, and possible in some single player modules (ie take an early paladin level, then shift your alignment from lawful good to lawful neutral after that paladin level is obtained).

This build draft attempts to combine the high Cha from Sorcerer with Blackguard's Dark Blessing for fabulous saves (double buff-able), and palemaster for crit/sneak immunity and an AC boost.
I put scribe scroll and craft wand in the build to be able to scribe a pile of Mord scrolls, summon IX scrolls, timestop scrolls in one's spare time, as well as ILMS wands / LSB wands. 
Although these can be switched for SF/GSF: Necromancy for +4 to DC for Wail spells. Or Spell Pen/Greater Spell Pen.
It has silent/empower/max for 0-1-2-3 IGMS and extend for damage shields combined with PM's crit/sneak immunity.
I take toughness and boost starting Con to 16 to assist with a damage shield strategy, with 370hp it can be capped at 610hp, with crit/sneak immunity + premonition/epic warding there should be enough to make it work.
I go Cha 32 so spells that require DC rolls can be effective there are a few I am interested in, grease, stinking cloud (one can protect yourself against your own mind affecting spells with Prot v Evil), 0-1-2-3 Flame Arrow / Firebrand, 0-1-2 Finger of Death, 0-1 Horrid Wilting and Wail.
Spell penetration could be tricky mid epics, with SP 18+1d20 at level 30 but I think Mord's which can lower spell resistance by 10, can help gap the breach there, and will be the level 9 spell taken with Sorc 18.
Undispellability is obtained at level 36, which is a little late, however it was a choice between that at level 36 or PM 10's crit/sneak immunity, and the crit + sneak immunity seemed stronger.
Blackguard allows for heavy armor / shields to be equipped in an environment where spellsword equipment (ie -arcane failure) is available, an alternative is to use crafted magic (scrolls/wands) with armor equipped, although my intention is for this sorceress to only melee with damage shields up, this could help protect against archers.
It was tempting to go Blackguard 3 for a late divine shield feat, however I thought the other feats in this build provided more, and there seemed to be enough AC in the build already with PM 10 and EMA.
The strength requirements for Blackguard (due to Power Attack/Cleave) are not completely wasted, as often I find myself having to equip items to boost strength due to encumbrance.

- Sorcerer King by TyrTemplar, has less HP in exchange for spell foci / divine shield (I like a high HP palemaster to tank for parties with the damage shields, it is more forgiving)
